title: ADCs can go mid like jhin or varus, but midlaners can't go APC?

replies.body:
Because of one critical reason.   Mages scale insanely hard on levels, which duo laning cost them XP and puts them 2-4 levels behind what they could have mid.


That is 100% the reason right there.

This.

Mages not going bot lane (or, pretty much, everyone not going bot lane but RANGED ADCs) has nothing to do with tower taking, and everything with XP distribution.

Melees of all kinds need XP for the increased tankiness from base stats. Ability focused champions need XP for their damage.
On the other, auto-attack damage does not scale as hard with XP - on most ADCs, buying a BF Sword gives you about the same amount of AD as 17 levels of experience. And being range means that you do not require the increased tankiness from base stats as much - for most champions, range does not scale with XP.

For the last point, there are obviously exceptions {{champion:18}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:222}} ), but if the range increase is tied to an ability, that ability tends to be leveled first.

This is what prevents bruisers bot sadly. 

Really hard to justify diversity here.

Or everyone will despise the changes and only use them in that role when they are absolutely broken.

I think there's a whole lot of minor reasons why that all add up together.

First, mages scale better with levels, and so they really want the solo lane experience.  I don't think it's AS big a deal as people make it out to be, but again, minor issues that all add up.

Secondly, AP is really easy to itemize against early on (Hexdrinker, Abyssal) whereas there's nothing you can really build against AD damage to the same effect (unless you're a tank, which a botlane carry typically isn't).  You might delay an ADC's build by quite a bit if you force them to build a Hexdrinker - but then such an item gives them a pretty big advantage and their lane will be a lot easier.

Third, teams practically require an ADC with how hard they scale.  There's only a couple APC champs that can even come close to the late game damage output  of an ADC (Karthus and Cassi come to mind) but then autoattacks are significantly harder to outplay than anything a mage does, and a full build ADC can be extremely hard to deal with because of that.

Personally, I think sending a mage bot can definitely work - but like many other things in the game, it just isn't _optimal_.
